course.title: Introduction to the Problems of Philosophy
course.meeting_text: M., W., (F.), at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: The course introduces students to philosophical argumentation and writing by investigating the following questions: Does god exist? What makes for good evidence? How ought we to act? What is the relationship between mind and body? Is there free will? Is there life after death, and if not, is death bad for us? We'll pay particular attention to how answers to one question interact with answers to the others. No previous experience with philosophy required. There will be many exercises and activities to develop your philosophical skills.
